  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE FOUND ON TRAILER WET WAS PLACED IN PLASTIC TUB MOVED TO QA STAGING LOCATION DescribePack: CONTENT LEAKED WHICH CAUSE OUTSIDE OF BOX TO BE WET DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE MOVED FORM QA STAGING LOCATION TO HAZMAT CAGE FOR PROESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023080634
item.description:
Report X-2023080634

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-02
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought over to QA department in our building by one of our management team they mentioned the package began leaking while it was being unloaded. DescribePack: Side of the package itself was wet and not looking to good, once I opened the package i then saw the bottles were just placed inside the box with barely ant protection for them at all to prevent the leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Immediately once I noticed that the leaking was happening I immediately placed the box and contents inside of a lined tote to prevent any more spread of the leaking.

item.title: Report X-2023080631
item.description:
Report X-2023080631

  • City: CHARLOTTE

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was held for missing shipping paper 3 business days and upon finding attached and released to move forward and upon pick up dropped causing leak DescribePack: package was dropped when picking up to move forward and began to seep through corner of box DurationRel: -1 and MitigateEffect: package was opened and leak was taking care accordingly

item.title: Report X-2023080622
item.description:
Report X-2023080622

  • City: NEWTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package wet when unloaded from trailer. Package given to QA. DescribePack: 5 gallon jug placed in box for shipping. Although Styrofoam peanuts placed in box, it did not keep it from shifting causing leakage from loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Box and Styrofoam peanuts absorbed liquid.

item.title: Report X-2023080567
item.description:
Report X-2023080567

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found by a manager at door 124 at KANN-289. Hazmat was brought to QA Hazmat cage for inspection. During the inspection it was found that the cap was broken/missing. The remaining cap was missing and not found inside the packaging. DescribePack: The failure was due to a broken/missing cap on one of the glass bottles. No other caps or bottles were damaged. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Bottles and package were placed into a 20-gallon salvage drum to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report E-2023080538
item.description:
Report E-2023080538

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-16
  • City: Charlotte
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ADVANTAGE TANK LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC unit was traveling eastbound on Morehead St near Charlotte, North Carolina when the claimant vehicle failed to yield from Elliott St and struck the right side of the trailer. The impact damaged the loading/unloading lines and resulted in approximately 5 gallons of gasoline being released. The Charlotte Fire Department responded and handled the clean-up.

item.title: Report X-2023080663
item.description:
Report X-2023080663

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in Kann-289 Unload A. QA was alerted to this package at 12:30am. Upon discovery package was leaking on the side of the box. One jug had loose caps and this caused some of the contents to leak out into the outer packaging destroying the packaging and part of the barcode label. An inhouse clean up was done and the package was taken into the QA Hazmat cage in a 20-gallon salvage drum. DescribePack: The failure was do to the closer on the jug not being tightened to the bottle. The jug and the outer packaging were placed into a salvage drum and sealed to prevent further damage. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The cap was tightened back to the jug and placed into a 20-gallon salvage drum and sealed tight.

item.title: Report I-2023080009
item.description:
Report I-2023080009

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-30T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-03
  • City: Charlotte
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Flight 2798 the customer used his personal Anker Powerbank to charge his phone when he noticed that it was beginning to swell and smoke. The customer informed the crew who placed the powerbank in the fire containment bag. The Flight continued to destination without further issue.

item.title: Report X-2023080538
item.description:
Report X-2023080538

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-31
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG WAS BROUGHT TO QA AFTER THE SORT AND THE BOTTOM WAS WET. 1 OF THE BOTTLES BUSTED INSIDE THE BOX AND LEAKED OUT. UNSURE OF HOW BOTTLE BROKE AND NO OTHER INFO WAS GIVEN TO ME. PKG WAS THEN SECURED AND LATER PROCESSED AS DAMAGED. DescribePack: BOTTLE BROKE INSIDE. INNER PACKING SEEMED FINE. NO HOLES, CRACKS, OR ANYTHING TO SIGNALS THIS WAS A PACKAGING ISSUE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PKG WAS PLACED IN A YELLOW HAZMAT DRUM AND TAKEN OFF THE SORT AND SECURED.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Loader failed t properly close loading external valve. Movement of loaded cargo tank caused material to exit valve and release .5 gallons of material. Driver properly closed external valve and cleaned material. Delivery made without additional incident.

item.title: Report E-2023070379
item.description:
Report E-2023070379

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-30T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-17
  • City: WINSTON SALEM
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ADVANTAGE TANK LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC unit was traveling northbound on US 52 near Winston-Salem, North Carolina in the left lane. The claimant vehicle attempted to change from the right lane into the left lane and struck the side of the KAG Energy, LLC trailer. The loading lines on the trailer were damaged and approximately 2 gallons of diesel fuel was released. The local fire department responded and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report I-2023070048
item.description:
Report I-2023070048

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-30T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-27
  • City: WARSAW
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: East Penn Logistics, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: An East Penn Driver was at a customer unloading product. He was lowering a pallet of batteries on the lift gate of his truck when the pallet started to tilt. The pallet of batteries slid off the tail gate. The driver admitted he did not lower the pallet jack making the load unstable. The batteries were picked up and customer kept them waiting for disposition from East Penn. The small spill was neutralized with soda ash by the driver.
